ontologyFramework.OFDataMapping.ReservatedDataType

Class NameMapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • ontologyFramework.OFDataMapping.ReservatedDataType.NameMapper

  • public class NameMapper
extends java.lang.Object
    This static class is used to represent a Data Type mapper which is by default defined in the framework. In particular, it is used to map the full classifier or a Java Class. So, given an ontological individual I which has only one Data-Property:
    I {@value #propName} "full.classifier.toJava.Class"^^string
    it returns a string which contains the pat. Namely: full.classifier.toJava.Class. Note that this mechanism is equivalent to the String Mapper but has been divided from him to guarantee more maintainability. Moreover, it does not implement the mapping of a string into the ontology, but only the reading of such information. This is done to allow the usage of customisable Mapper for such data type without affect the initialization phase of the framework.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Buoncomapgni Luca

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String NAME_propName
      Defines the default name of the ontologica Data Property to map java full qualifier between the system and the data structure.

    • Method Detail

      • getNameFromOntology

        public static java.lang.String getNameFromOntology(java.lang.String individualName,
                                   OWLReferences ontoRef)
        given the name of an individual as a String it retrieves the actual individual and use it to call getNameFromOntology(OWLNamedIndividual, OWLReferences). The returning value is than propagated.
        Parameters:
        individualName - name of the ontological individual
        ontoRef - OWL references to the ontology
        Returns:
        the name (full qualifier) of a class

      • getNameFromOntology

        public static java.lang.String getNameFromOntology(org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLNamedIndividual individual,
                                   OWLReferences ontoRef)
        Given an ontological individual which has a data property "hasTypeName" it returns a string containing the name which should point to a class through its full qualifier. The result can be different if the property does not contain a string ( see OWLLiteral.getLiteral() for more). It returns Null if the individual does not exist or if it does not have such data property.
        Parameters:
        individual - ontological individual from which retrieve the name
        ontoRef - OWL references to the ontology
        Returns:
        string stored in the property
